Docs.summary: Implements the GenerateBootstrapper task. Use the GenerateBootstrapper element in your project file to create and execute this task. For usage and parameter information, see [GenerateBootstrapper Task](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ca3ba2c6-d2ea-41f2-b7e3-0fc2b0730460).

Docs.summary: Gets or sets whether a component runs with elevated permissions when it is installed on a target computer.
Docs.value: Returns if the installed component runs with elevated permissions; otherwise .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property can be set in the project file, but it is not exposed in the MSBuild schema. In the project file's `MsiBootstrapper` section, set the [RequiresElevation Property](https://docs.microsoft.com/previous-versions/visualstudio/visual-studio-2010/bb384030(v=vs.100)) to `True`.
A component runs with elevated permissions when it writes a registry key or is being installed to the GAC. For example, if you are installing assemblies to the GAC, you need to set this property to `True`.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the built location of bootstrapper package files.
Docs.value: The built location of bootstrapper package files.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.GenerateBootstrapper.CopyComponents%2A> is `true`, the values of <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.GenerateBootstrapper.BootstrapperComponentFiles%2A> should all be based on <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.GenerateBootstrapper.OutputPath%2A>. Otherwise, the <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.GenerateBootstrapper.BootstrapperComponentFiles%2A> values are based on the value of the <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.GenerateBootstrapper.Path%2A> property.

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")
set: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a location for the bootstrapper to look for installation prerequisites to install.
Docs.value: The location for the bootstrapper to look for installation prerequisites to install.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property can have the following values::
- `HomeSite`: Indicates that the prerequisite is being hosted by the component vendor.
- `Relative`: Indicates that the preqrequisite is at the same location of the application.
- `Absolute`: Indicates that all components are to be found at a centralized URL. This value should be used in conjunction with the `ComponentsUrl` property.
If <xref:Microsoft.Build.Tasks.GenerateBootstrapper.ComponentsLocation%2A> is not specified, `HomeSite` is used by default.
